title: type-toys
content:
Cleaning up I came across this "font" I started way back when the kids were little.  
It was going to be a train set that fit on Brio tracks.

Put it aside to look for non-toxic paints and an got busy and never got back to the project.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023205353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/june_07%20011_6231.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023205353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/june_07%20015_3823.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023205353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/june_07%20012_3885.jpg)

(just sharing - Thanks \<|:¬)
author: russellm

comments.content:
If you finished it, these days I wonder if they'd even say, "What's it for?", before going back to their X-Box or Nintendo.

But maybe you can still finish it off for the grandkids before they are too jaded, and post a photo when you are done.  
; )
Yeah, maybe - But what if I put laserbeams on the acenders?

That's thinking out of the box, I'll give you that.  
; )
It looks great. The shapes have some speed! Brio is a great toy, but I've given credit to Legos for artistic inspiration.
